Up for sale in our Tampa Showroom is this stunning example of American style and power the 1970 Chevrolet Corvette. These models were a new approach to the classic means of styling developed during the 1960s to create a bridge between American power and European styling. This model here was built with a stout 454 Cubic Inch engine built for speed and ready to deliver. Backed up by a 3 speed Automatic transmission to increase overall comfort while driving. The inside of this car is lined in a beautiful Black Vinyl that seems to hug you as you brace yourself around turns. You can blast the radio with the classic AM/FM setup in here. Going out for a drive intending to show off your classy ride? Take off the T-tops and strap them in as you blast down the street with the wind going through your hair. This well equipped Corvette also comes with features like Power Brakes and Power Steering to give you top class luxury while you drive. Some of the world class features this car had was the addition of Power Windows from the factory proving that Corvette was going to be a leader in the industry for both form and function. Planting this car to the ground and a set of classy GM Rally Wheels wrapped up in Radial Tires to maintain control of the road. Take a ride in a classic Corvette and you will understand why even today they are some of the most desirable drivers out there. Options include A/C AM/FM Radio T-Tops Power Brakes Power Steering Power Windows Seat Belts Vinyl Interior Radial Tires Raised White Letters and Rally Wheels. To see this car in better detail including over 100+ High Definition pictures and a full length High Definition Video please go to www.Gatewayclassiccars.com. To see this car in person please make an appointment by calling us at (813) 645-6200 or by emailing us at
[Email Dealer]

1970 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray | Ardell Brown Classic Carswww.ardellscars.com/1970-chevrolet-corvette-stingrayThis is an original 1970 Corvette with one re-spray. It is equipped with the 370 hp LT-1 350 V-8 and 4 speed manual transmission. It is finished in Monza Red with Black Custom (leather) interior. Other options include power steering and disc brakes, tilt/telescopic steering column, Rally Wheels and removable T-TopsThe third generation Corvette, patterned after the Mako Shark II concept car, was introduced for the 1968 model year and was in production until 1982. C3 coupes featured the first use of T-top removable roof panels. It introduced monikers that were later revived, such as LT-1, ZR-1, Z07 and Collector Edition.
One owner, took delivery Dec 1968. 350/350, PS, AIR, Leather interior. Totally original except for consumable items.
Bold color, a ton of upgrades, A/C interior, and a new performance V8 under the hood – this 1970 Chevrolet Corvette convertible is absolutely one of the best classic car values you're going to find.

Daytona Yellow is a great color to have on a Stingray.  It's a rare color offered for only a couple of years, and its name alone instantly reminds you of the Corvette's victories on the racetrack.  It brightly highlights the crisp lines of the shark-like nose, rounded fenders, and integrated rear spoiler.  And this one has two terrific attitudes you can choose from.  The black convertible top coordinates with the custom black side vents for a hint of two-tone flair, or you can use the color-matched hardtop to maximize the bold yellow.  No matter which way you motor, you're going to enjoy plenty of bright work. On a properly presented '70 that means nicely finished intricate chrome bumpers, bright rocker panels, and iconic Rally wheels.

Inside there have been a ton of great investments.  It starts with an upgrade to later-style C3 bucket seats.  These tan leather units not only have better bolstering, but they also offer better access to the rear storage.  Plus, custom matching door panels, center console, and dash mean you'll be proud to show off this convertible's interior.  The custom sports steering wheel also has coordinating tan inserts, and it gives you even better grip.  Beyond that is a large speedo and tach, and you have a full array of auxiliary readouts just to the side.  But more than just a driver's machine, this one is comfortable, too.  Power windows, a tilt steering column, and the stereo has been upgraded to an AM/FM/CD unit that has a fold-out screen for GPS navigation.  Because the air conditioning is now blowing cold with modern R134a, you can enjoy the drop top experience well into the summer season.

Under the hood is a fresh GM 350 cubic-inch crate motor.  The V8 only has about 2,000 miles on it, and you can tell it's new by the shine of all the polished elements like the intake, air topper, master cylinder, alternator, compressor, and so much more.  Beyond the style, you'll find substance you'll really enjoy.  The V8 inhales deeply through a four-barrel carburetor, and it exhales with authority as headers contribute to the rumble of the Flowmaster dual exhaust.  Plus, there is an aluminum radiator w/electric fan so this classic 'Vette can stay cool even if you're in traffic with the A/C pumping.  But really we know you're going to be enjoying this one on the open road.  After all, the performance on the new V8 combines with a fully independent suspension, a new front sway bar, power steering, a three-speed automatic transmission, and four-wheel disc brakes to create a terrific classic car experience.

There have been a lot of great investments in this cool convertible, so you know it's the right classic Corvette at the right price.  The only question is will you be fast enough to grab this deal? Call now!

1971 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray, Convertible
All numbers matching, 350 L48 110K mile car, 2nd or 3rd owner.

Optional Hard Top, Power Brakes, Power Steering, A/C (will need recharge and/or upgrade to R134), optional shoulder belts (very rare on convertible cars), THM Auto Transmission, optional rear end gearing. Original turbine wheel covers included.
Brands Hatch Green original color (1 respray), over Dark Green interior, white top.
With the above listed options, this car comes out as less than 1 of only roughly 300 built.
This car was purchased by the current owner in 1986. He was looking for a Vette and was not excited by the new crop of 84/C4 Corvettes nor was he thrilled with the rubber bumper C3 Stingrays.

He found this 71 Stingray locally and proceeded to get in and drive her. The owner of local service station/garage, he always took great care of her. Unfortunately, the wear and tear of his career took a toll on his body and after several back surgeries, was unable to get back into the car of his dreams and drive her.

In 2000 the car was parked in his heated, concrete garage, with the thought that at some point, he'd be able to get back in and enjoy her again. To no avail however. He purchased a high performance sedan (a Mercury Marauder) that he could easily enter and egress... and the Corvette sat. Being a garage owner, he understood the idea of not letting a car just sit, so it was started and kept up regularly, just not driven.
At this point he has realized that getting in and enjoying this Muscle/Sports car will not happen regularly enough to make it worth keeping her around and it's now time to move her on to a new home.

She is in very good shape. No rust on the frame. The paint shines nicely and has minimal cracking and crazing from the fiberglass beneath. The interior has a couple of small seam splits on the driver seat but otherwise will benefit from a deep cleaning/carpet shampooing and will look great. She runs and drives well. After sitting for roughly 15-17 years, it would be wise to look into and address items such as brakes, hoses/lines, tires, etc.
The asking price on her is only $25,500 and is negotiable.
Please contact me with any questions, comments, for many more photos, to make an offer or to arrange a time to see her in person.
Thank you for the interest!

Now for sale in our Houston Showroom is this 1970 Chevrolet Corvette Convertible. The chrome bumper Corvettes are some of the most desirable classic cars to date. If your looking for a nice classic to turn some heads this is one that will do the job. To run this car through the powerband is a strong running 350 Crate with only around 3000 miles on it. It"??s paired to a stout Muncie 4 -Speed with 4.11 gears. The car had undergone a paint job about 5-6 years ago and in good condition. The power steering pump fuel pump power steering control module electronic ignition and emergency brake had all been replaced to ensure the car handles and run well. The car also features 4-wheel disk brakes and tires with plenty of tread life left in them. The interior of the car remains in original condition with minimal wear and tear. The black leather interior shows well with no major rips or tears. The manual convertible top makes for a great summer driving experience in this classic. The car also features and aftermarket stereo system so you can enjoy some of your favorite songs from your childhood or maybe parent"??s childhood for some. . 1972 CORVETTE CONVERTIBLE. . . . . BLACK PAINT ON A STRAIGHT BODY. . . . . . BLACK CANVAS TOP. . . . . . . TAN INTERIOR. . . . . TILT-TELESCOPIC STEERING WHEEL. . . . . AMFM RADIO. . . MATCHING NUMBERS 350 ENGINE. . . . . 4 SPEED MANUAL TRANS. . . . RARE FACTORY AIR CONDITIONING. . . . . . POWER BRAKES. . . .. POWER STEERING. . . . . VERY GOOD UNDER CARRIAGE. . . . . . GOOD FRONT AND REAR BUMPERS. . . . .RUNS AND DRIVES GREAT. . . . . .WE OFFER WORK WIDE TRANSPORT AND COLLECTOR AUTO LOANS.

This 1972 Chevrolet Corvette convertible hits all the high notes: a matching-numbers V8, four-speed manual transmission, and a great color combo.  So look over all the details of this classic to see how it's the perfect mix of investment and originality.

This one really seems to get its total appearance right, and it all starts with the paint. This is a later application that properly applied a bright white with plenty of luster.  Because both the folding soft top and removable hardtop are in an equally pristine white, this has a terrific total coordination no matter how you drive it.  Also the clear coat shine of the paint loves to highlight all the iconic pieces of this Stingray.  After all, the design perfectly bends the rounded fenders with sharp elements like the well-creased door line and shark-like nose.  Plus, the panels have the fit of good care an investment right down to the smooth headlight flaps and the doors you can shut with authority.  These earlier C3s are also for the bright work lovers, and so the thin bumpers, bright grilles, rocker panels, and Rally wheels come together to add to this vintage shine package.

While either one of the white tops give this 'Vette a sophisticated appearance, neither one of them can beat the look with the roof off.  That's because the factory-correct blue give this one a European-like sensibility.  The bright tones on the door panels, carpeting, dash, and newly covered bucket seats are like looking into an ocean.  This classic really does a have a period-correct feel, right down to the heat/defrost sliders and factory AM/FM stereo.  But more than just appearance, this one was meant to be driven.  That's why you have the three-spoke sports steering wheel that gives you a terrific view of the large speedo and tach.  Just to the side is a full auxiliary gauge panel that's mounted high so you never have to let your eyes stray too far.

When you lift the hood, you can see this car is the total package. This is the original, matching-numbers 350 cubic inch V8.  With all the components in top condition and the belts & hoses looking so tidy, there's nothing to get in the way of seeing the shine on the air cleaner, distributor shield, and other polished pieces.  While the appearance is great, you also have the confidence that this original motor is fresh from a recent tune-up.  The total control that four-speed manual transmission gives you over the V8 and its rumbling soundtrack is another reminder of how much a driver's classic this really is.  Plus, the power steering, four-wheel disc brakes, and fully independent suspension keeps this one of the best vintage sports cars around.
Complete with owner's manual, this Stingray provides distinction and history in a terrific droptop package.  So don't miss your chance, call today!

Just Toys Classic Cars always brings you the best Corvette selection around and this one is right up there.  Here is a 1973 Chevrolet Corvette.  This one went through a color change about 10 or so years ago.  It was born Elkhart Green and is now a beautiful Red.  As you can see in the pics, this car gleams from any angle.  This car is one that needs to be in your collection for sure.

As you can tell from the pics, there has been a lot that was redone on this car.  The seats have been recovered in their original medium saddle and the door panels, carpet, dash, and bottom side of the T- Tops are in great shape.  This is the original interior color as you can see on the trim tag code.  This still has the AM/FM radio that it was born with as well.

Under the hood is the business end of things for this 73 vette.  This car was born a 454 4 speed.  In the late 90's a newer 454 was installed.  However, the original block, heads, cam, intake manifold, distributor, and exhaust manifolds come with the car.  So get in that comfortable drivers seat and give that key a turn.  Now, listen to those Flowmaster mufflers come to life and giddy up you are ready to have some fun in this little red corvette.  So put this bad boy in first and step off that clutch and do your best to get that ear to ear grin off of your face.

This is just an awesome car from tip to tail and it needs to be in your garage today.  We offer classic car financing for those that would like to take advantage of the option.  They offer great rates and terms with as little as 10% down.  This way you can get the car of your dreams and you do not have to take all of your cash out of the bank at once.  You can start that dream today by going to www.justtoysclassiccars.com/financing  and just follow the easy step by step instructions.  We look forward to speaking with you soon and we look forward to making you the newest member of the Just Toys Classic Cars family.

Just Toys Classic Cars is your Corvette headquarters and we are proud to present to you this stunning 1973 Corvette convertible.  This car is absolutely stunning.  It has had one repaint of its original Mille Miglia Red and it shines and shows amazing.  The fit on this car is just like it should be as well.  This car is absolutely amazing.

The interior of this sweet ride is in awesome shape as well.  There are no rips or tears in the seats or dash and the tan top is brand new.  This car is a time capsule.  It has the original radio in it and the clock works as well and everything is easily reachable and pleasing to the eye.  This has always been one of the great things about this sports car through its history.  You slide yourself in to the seat and you instantly just feel good and want to see how fast you can go.

Now, this is 1973 so by this time, horsepower was not at a premium, but you were driving a light weight Corvette.  It sounded awesome and when you put the top down, even better.  The original numbers matching 350 on this sweet ride only put out a little over 200 HP, but it has plenty of get up and go in it.  The miles you see on the odometer are original.  Everything has been very well maintained.  All of this is mated to the original transmission and rear end.  We can not say enough how well this car has been maintined.  The only option that it doesn't have is the tilt/telescopic wheel.  It has power steering, power brakes, and cold a/c.  This would have been an expensive vette back in the day and the values are still going up today.  So hit that key and listen to that new exhaust fire up in your ear and work on trying to get rid of that ear to ear grin on your face.

So put the top down on this baby, slap it in to drive, and get ready to have the drive of your life.  This car hits all of the right senses, it looks great, sounds awesome, and the smell of the wind in your hair with the top down is just te icing on the cake.  Make this bad boy yours today.
